Key Match Events: Spencer Dinwiddie scored 11 of Dallas' first 19 points, helping them to an early lead.
P.J. Washington scored 16 points in a row for the Mavericks in the first quarter.
Sacramento's Trey Lyles scored an and-one to cut the lead to single digits in the second quarter.
Domantas Sabonis scored a finger roll to take the lead for Sacramento in the second quarter.
P.J. Washington scored a season-high 28 points.
De'Aaron Fox led Sacramento with 33 points, breaking their six-game losing streak.
Domantas Sabonis had 17 points, 16 rebounds, and seven assists.
Pre-Game Insights: Dallas Mavericks were down four starters including Luka Doncic, Dereck Lively II, Kyrie Irving, and Klay Thompson.
Sacramento Kings were reeling after firing their head coach on Friday.
Post-Match Reflections: Spencer Dinwiddie led the Mavericks with a season-high 30 points.
The Mavericks will be on the road again on Wednesday for a big game against the Rockets.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks shot just 42.1% from the floor, getting 24% of their points from the free-throw line.
Sacramento had 18 offensive rebounds compared to Dallas' two.
